creditline: Gift of Lora and Martin G. Weinstein
image_copyright: Â© Doug Argue. All rights reserved.
inscription: Quote by William Bradford printed with letterpress within the composition. Here, Bradford described the case of Thomas Granger, a teenager executed, in September 1642, for buggery with a mare, a cow, two goats, five sheep, two calves and a turkey.
medium: Wood engraving in blue-black ink, with letterpress on ivory Japan paper
provenance: Lora and Martin Weinstein, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 1996.
title: Untitled (Plymouth Plantation)
